info.title: Acquia Site Factory REST API
info.description: OpenAPI 3.0 specification for Acquia Site Factory REST API

parameters.name: user_id
parameters.description: The user ID of the user.

get.description: Gets a list of audit events.

parameters.name: module
parameters.description: The system name of the module.

parameters.name: scope
parameters.description: The general scope of the changes.

parameters.name: uid
parameters.description: The user who made the change.

put.summary: Configure the backup expiration and automatic deletion.
put.description: Configure the backup expiration and automatic deletion setting.

expiration_days.description: Number of days (between 1 and 365) after which backups get automatically deleted.

get.summary: Get the current backup expiration and automatic deletion setting.
get.description: Get the current backup expiration and automatic deletion setting.

get.summary: Get current centralized role management settings.
get.description: Get current centralized role management settings.

put.summary: Set the centralized role management settings for a given role.
put.description: Set the centralized role management settings for a given role.

parameters.name: factory_role
parameters.description: The site factory role. Currently the only supported ones are "content_editor", "platform_admin" and "site_builder".

site_role.description: The corresponding role on the site.

delete.summary: Disable the centralized role management settings for a given role.
delete.description: Disable the centralized role management settings for a given role.

parameters.name: factory_role
parameters.description: The site factory role. Currently the only supported ones are "content_editor", "platform_admin" and "site_builder".

get.description: Fetches the list of available stacks.

parameters.name: codebase_id
parameters.description: Id of stack whose details are to be changed.

name.description: New stack name to be updated.

tangle_alias.description: New tangle alias name for tangle associated with that stack.

get.description: Fetches the details of available stacks.

command.description: The command that should be executed.

sites_affected.description: Possible values: dev-sites - sites without custom domains, prod-sites - sites with custom domains, all

enabled.description: If the cron should be enabled.

thread_percentage.description: The percentage of cron threads that should be used for this cron. Value has to be an integer between 0 and 100.

stacks.description: An array of stack ids for which the cron should be enabled.

get.summary: Get cron jobs. sites_affected: dev-sites(without custom domains)|prod-sites(with custom domains)|all
get.description: Get all cron jobs (paged).

command.description: The command that should be executed.

sites_affected.description: Possible values: dev-sites - sites without custom domains, prod-sites - sites with custom domains, all

enabled.description: If the cron should be enabled.

thread_percentage.description: The percentage of cron threads that should be used for this cron. Value has to be an integer between 0 and 100.

stacks.description: An array of stack ids for which the cron should be enabled.

get.description: Get cron job by its id.

Get all domains known to Site Factory.

 Possible domain types:
   simple|collectionLive|collectionInternal|factoryStandard.
Get domains by node ID.
Get domain status.

post.summary: Backfill the current factory standard domain templates.
post.description: Backfill the current factory standard domain templates.

get.summary: Get the current factory standard domain templates.
get.description: Get the current factory standard domain templates.

put.summary: Set the factory standard domain template.
put.description: Set the factory standard domain template.

parameters.name: template_name
parameters.description: The template name to change. Currently the only supported ones are "site_prod", "site_nonprod", "collection_prod" and "collection_nonprod".

delete.summary: Remove the factory standard domain template.
delete.description: Remove the factory standard domain template.

parameters.name: template_name
parameters.description: The template name to remove. Currently the only supported ones are "site_prod", "site_nonprod", "collection_prod" and "collection_nonprod".

get.description: Get the members of a group.

uids.description: A single user ID, or an array of user IDs.
A single user ID, or an array of user IDs.

get.description: Get a group by group ID.
Get a list of groups.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: A positive integer not higher than 100.

group_name.description: The name of the site group to create.

parent_id.description: The parent group ID, if applicable.

uids.description: A single user ID, or an array of user IDs.
A single user ID, or an array of user IDs.

post.summary: Add site(s) to a site group.
post.description: Add site(s) to a site group.

site_ids.description: Either a single site ID, or an array of site IDs.

delete.summary: Remove site(s) from a site group.
delete.description: Remove site(s) from a site group.

site_ids.description: Either a single site ID, or an array of site IDs.

get.description: Get the sites of a group.
List installation profiles.

parameters.name: stack_id
parameters.description: Get only the profiles on the given stack.

post.summary: Sets the installation profile as default.
post.description: Sets the installation profile as default.

get.summary: List monthly aggregated dynamic request statistics.
get.description: Gets the monthly aggregated dynamic request statistics.

parameters.name: stack_id
parameters.description: The stack id for which to fetch the dynamic request statistics. If there is only one stack, this parameter can be omitted.

parameters.name: start_from
parameters.description: The first date from which to start showing the statistics in the format of YYYY-MM.

parameters.name: sort_order
parameters.description: The sort order direction. Either asc or desc.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The number of months to be listed. Maximum value is 120.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The page number to show in the list.

get.summary: List monthly dynamic request statistics by domain.
get.description: Gets the monthly dynamic request statistics by domain.

parameters.name: stack_id
parameters.description: The stack id for which to fetch the dynamic request statistics. If there is only one stack, this parameter can be omitted.

parameters.name: date
parameters.description: The month in the format of YYYY-MM.

parameters.name: domain_name
parameters.description: Full domain name or a prefix for filtering the results.

parameters.name: sort_order
parameters.description: The sort order direction. Either asc or desc.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The number of domains to be listed. (max 100)

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The page number to show in the list.

post.summary: Pause/resume task processing for a specific task

paused.description: Leave the task in paused or unpaused state.

level.description: Pause/unpause just the specified task or all its children (task|family).

get.description: Checks whether the API is responding.
Gets a list of roles.
Retrieve a role by role ID.

parameters.name: role_id
parameters.description: The role ID of the user role.

parameters.name: role_id
parameters.description: The role ID of the user role.

parameters.name: role_id
parameters.description: The role ID of the user role.

new_name.description: The new name for the user role.

get.description: Get current security settings.

minimum_password_length.description: Sets the minimum password length required for customers.

minimum_required_password_strength.description: Sets the password strength required for customers.

two_step_verification.description: Sets if tfa required for customers.

sign_out_inactivity_time.description: Automatically sign out of the account after seconds, required when sign_out_inactive_user_accounts is set.

automatically_disable_accounts_after_day.description: Number of days after which an account will be disabled, required when automatically_disable_accounts is set.

get.summary: Get the version of the Site Factory
get.description: Gets the (release) version the Site Factory is on.
Gets a list of site collections.

parameters.name: remove_empty
parameters.description: True to only return collections containing active sites.

name.description: The name of the new site collection.

site_ids.description: Either a single site ID, or an array of site IDs.

group_ids.description: Either a single group ID, or an array of group IDs.

internal_domain_prefix.description: The site collection's internal domain prefix. Uses the "name" parameter's value if not set.

get.description: Get detailed information about a site collection.

post.summary: Add site(s) to a site collection.
post.description: Add site(s) to a site collection.

site_ids.description: A site ID or an array of site IDs.

post.summary: Remove site(s) from a site collection.
post.description: Remove site(s) from a site collection.

site_ids.description: A site ID, or an array of site IDs.

post.summary: Set the primary site of a site collection.
post.description: Set the primary site of a site collection.

get.description: Get current site guard config.

put.summary: Enable and set the site guard settings.

message.description: The message which the site guard should output.

username.description: The username for the site guard.

password.description: The password for the site guard.

get.description: Get current site ownership settings.

username.description: The default owner username. The user has to have the "Platform admin" role.

get.description: Get current site update priority.

priority.description: An array of site node ids in the desired update order.

post.summary: Trigger the site variables set up on the sites.
post.description: Trigger the site variables set up on the sites.

get.summary: Get the site variables for a given site.
get.description: Get the site variables for a given site.

put.summary: Change a site variable for a given site.
put.description: Change a site variable for a given site.

variable_scrub.description: If the variable should be removed during staging.

delete.summary: Clear all site variables for a given site.
delete.description: Clear all site variables for a given site.

delete.summary: Remove a site variable for a given site.
delete.description: Remove a site variable for a given site.

get.description: Gets a list of sites.

parameters.name: stack_id
parameters.description: Show sites on a specific stack.

parameters.name: domain_contains
parameters.description: Show sites whose domain contains this value.

parameters.name: domain_not_contains
parameters.description: Show sites whose domain does not contain this value.

parameters.name: has_custom_domain
parameters.description: Whether to only show sites with custom domains.

parameters.name: site_owner
parameters.description: Either a user id or a comma separated list of user ids.

parameters.name: show_custom_domain
parameters.description: Return the first custom domain if the site has one instead of the internal one.

group_ids.description: Either a single group ID, or an array of group IDs.

install_profile.description: The install profile to be used to install the site.

stack_id.description: The stack id where the site should go.

get.description: Get detailed information about a site.

group_ids.description: Either a single group ID, or an array of group IDs.

exact_copy.description: A boolean indicating whether or not to create an exact copy.

label.description: The human-readable description of this backup.

callback_url.description: The callback URL, which is invoked upon completion.

callback_method.description: The callback method, "GET", or "POST". Uses "POST" if empty.

caller_data.description: Data that should be included in the callback, json encoded.

components.description: Array of components to be included in the backup. The following component names are accepted: codebase, database, public files, private files, themes. When omitting this parameter it will default to a backup with every component.

get.description:
List site backups.

 Note that the results are sorted from newest backup to oldest.

get.summary: Get a temporary site backup URL
get.description: Get temporary site backup URL.

parameters.name: lifetime
parameters.description: The number of seconds the temporary URL is good for.

callback_url.description: The callback URL, which is invoked upon completion.

callback_method.description: The callback method, "GET", or "POST". Uses "POST" if empty.

caller_data.description: Data that should be included in the callback, json encoded.

target_site_id.description: ID of the site to restore the backup onto.

backup_id.description: ID of the backup to restore defaults to the most recent.

callback_url.description: The callback URL, which is invoked upon completion.

callback_method.description: The callback method, "GET", or "POST". Uses "POST" if empty.

caller_data.description: Data that should be included in the callback, json encoded.

components.description: Array of components to be restored from the backup. The following component names are accepted: database, public files, private files, themes. When omitting this parameter it will default to the backup's every component.

post.description: Clear Drupal and Varnish caches for a site.

get.description: Retrieves available environments user can stage to.

sites.description: Node IDs of sites to deploy.

wipe_target_environment.description: Use this option to wipe the management console and all stacks on the selected environment before deploying sites.

wipe_stacks.description: Stack ids to wipe. It will be ignored if wipe_target_environment is true.

synchronize_all_users.description: Use this parameter to only stage the user accounts that are required for the provided sites and the related site collections and site groups.

detailed_status.description: Provide a status email for each site as it completes.

skip_site_files.description: Skip copying the staged down sites' files.

skip_site_files_overwrite.description: File patterns to skip copying during the stage down process. Ignored if skip_site_files is false.

force_psu_hook.description: Force post-staging-update hook to run even if VCS paths are the same on prod and non-prod.

get.description: Get a service status report.

put.description: Modify the status of the services.

all.description: on, off, or something strtotime accepts

site_creation.description: on, off, or something strtotime accepts

site_duplication.description: on, off, or something strtotime accepts

domain_management.description: on, off, or something strtotime accepts

bulk_operations.description: on, off, or something strtotime accepts

get.summary: (Internal use only) Get Task class information.
get.description: Return data about WIP classes
Returns data about WIP tasks.

parameters.name: class
parameters.description: A WIP class name to filter on.

parameters.name: group
parameters.description: A WIP group name to filter on.

get.summary: (Internal use only) Get Task log information.
get.description: Returns log entries about WIP tasks.

parameters.name: level
parameters.description: The minimum status level to display

parameters.name: descendants
parameters.description: Include the logs of all descendant tasks.

delete.summary: Delete tasks from the work pool.
delete.description: Delete a task and its descendants.

put.summary: Terminate tasks in the work pool.
put.description: Terminate a task and its descendants.

get.description: Get current task log settings.

wip_log_level.description: Level of Wip log messages to keep on successful completion.

wip_log_maximum_level.description: The maximum log level that will be written to the log.

get.description:
Gets the deploy key that needs to be added to external theme repositories.

 Add this deploy key to your theme repositories, so that the Acquia Cloud
 Site Factory platform gets access to your repository and is able to deploy
 updated themes to your sites.

post.description: Processes the stored theme change notifications.

sitegroup_id.description: The ID of a specific sitegroup to process e.g. "tangle001".

post.description: Refreshes the site's themes from the external theme repository.

put.description: Sets the site's external theme data.

delete.description: Deletes the site's external theme data.

event.description: The type of theme event. Either "create", "modify", or "delete".

nid.description: The node ID of the related entity (site or group). Not relevant for the "global" scope.

theme.description: The system name of the theme. Only relevant for "theme" scope notifications.

uid.description: The user id owning the notification and who should get notified if an error occurs during processing.

username.description: New owner username to which site needs to be transferred (either username or email field is required).

email.description: New owner email id to which site needs to be transferred.

force_transfer.description: Transfer site ownership without mail confirmation from owner and recipient.

start_time.description: A start time string, parseable by strtotime(). Interpreted as UTC if no timezone is specified.

sites_ref.description: A VCS ref to deploy to the sites.

factory_ref.description: A VCS ref to deploy to the Factory.

stack_id.description: The stack id to release to.

site_update_fail_action.description: Action to be performed on sites when updates fail. Either "online" or "offline"

db_update_arguments.description: Custom arguments to supply to the db-update hooks. Space separated alphanumeric characters only.

get.description: Gets the status of a running update process.

pause.description: leave the task in paused or unpaused state.

post.summary: Change the start time of an update process

get.description: Gets a list of users.

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of user IDs.

parameters.name: role_ids
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of role IDs.

parameters.name: uid_min
parameters.description: First uid value to start with.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of Drupal user fields.

mail.description: The email address of the user.

pass.description: The user's password. (Included in the response, if not provided.)

roles.description: Either a single role name, or an array of role names.

get.description: Retrieve a user by user ID.

parameters.name: user_id
parameters.description: The user ID of the user.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of fields to retrieve.

parameters.name: user_id
parameters.description: The user ID of the user.

parameters.name: user_id
parameters.description: The user ID of the user.

mail.description: The email address of the user.

roles.description: Single role name, or an array of them.

tfa_status.description: The user's TFA status, either 0 or 1.

get.description: Get a list of VCS refs.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Either "sites" or "factory". (Note: "factory" is restricted to Acquia employees.)

get.description: Gets the status of a Wip task.
